ast.name: animations
ast.comment: fade in and fade out for sprites

body.text: This library allows to fade in and fade out elements.
## Initialization
The library works with a board so we start by creating one for this example.
Make sure to call `initialize` once with the board before calling other actions.
## Fade in
`fade in` makes sprites appearing by varying their opacity from 0 to 1 over a given duration.
Call `fade in` with the sprite and desired duration in seconds.
## Flushing animations
`flush` will apply all current animations and return when it is done. Optionally, you can specify to evolve the board as well.
## Fade out
Similarly to `fade in`, you can specify a sprite and the duration to fade from 1 to 0 opacity.
## Gameloop
You can interleave the animation in the regular gameloop execution. Simply call `evolve` after evolving your board.
The `while` loop below simulates a gameloop.
Call 'evolve' in the gameloop
Schedule the sprite to fade in
make sure not hidden
Evolves the animations
Initializes the library
Schedules the sprite to fade out
make sure not hidden
Flushes all the existing animations. `evolve board` indicates whether the `evolve` action on board should be called as well.

x6XOso60RkZGpo4fZw09FYda.text: This library allows to fade in, fade out and move elements.

xjleUfSmVMsczLU0drCEf9AR.text: `flush` will apply all current animations and return when it is done. Optionally, you can specify to evolve the board as well by passing `true` to `flush`.

kx2oXCDosJVNvpIwt2QpwoAR.text: You can have the sprite move to a particular location using a smooth trajectory using `move to`.

SbfY7RVzyhC7OlVyqlvo32rR.text: Smoothly moves the sprites to the `(x,y)` position in `seconds` from its current location
